concept.title: Two-variable Data Table
concept.shortdesc: The layout of a two-variable data table.

conbody.p: The two-variable data table uses a formula that contains two list of input values. The formula must refer to two different input cells: the row input cell and the column input cell.
The overall layout looks like a data table with 1 input cell, but there are some important differences:

ul.li: A data table with 1 input cell can evaluate multiple formulas, while with 2 input cells only the results from 1 formula can be calculated.
The values for the variables are both in a column and a row.

li.p: The upper left cell must contain the formula (or a reference to the formula).
